text:
All the way my Saviour leads me:
What have | to ask beside?

Can | doubt His tender mercy,
Who throâ€™ life has been my Guide?
Heavenly peace, divinest comfort,
Here by faith in Him to dwell!

For | know whate'er befall me,
Jesus doeth all things well; well

All the way my Saviour leads me:
Cheers each winding path | tread,
Gives me grace for every trial,
Feeds me with the living bread.
Though my weary steps may falter,
And my soul athirst may be,
Gushing from the rock before me,
Lo! a spring of joy | see; see.

All the way my Saviour leads me:
Oh, the fulness of His love!


Perfect rest to me is promised

In my Father's house above.

When my spirit, clothed immortal,

Wings its flight to realms of day,

This, my song through endless ages

Jesus, led me all the way; way.
b Fanny J. Crossby
